result.execSummary:
The defendant Marshaud J Baker was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Court ordered bail be applied to fine/costs ONLY and balance to poster.  $200 DNA surcharge and court costs remitted.  $67 VW surcharge paid by bail.
Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Brittany C. or Melissa G.
Court finds defendant eligible for expunction under 973.015 upon successful completion of probation.

Defendant advised of requirement to provide DNA sample.  Defendant shall complete a risk and needs assessment and comply with care plan goals related to prioritized need areas identified.  Any other conditions DOC, Probation/Parole Department may impose.
Court costs remitted.  Court ordered bail be applied to fine/costs ONLY and balance to poster.  $67 VW surcharge paid by bail.
All other conditions are the same as count 17.
